GT.content: [re: 2 characters in “Counterfeit Money”] espacement: ils s’éloignent du même pas, mais d’un pas qui aussi doit être tout autre
GT.linkedContent: [re: 2 characters in “Counterfeit Money”] espacement: ils s’éloignent du même pas, mais d’un pas qui aussi doit être tout autre

GT.content: khōra is compared to mother & nurse, not part of oppositional couple, 3rd genus, does not belong to “race of women (genos gynaikōn), mother w/out engendering, not an origin, a before signifying no temporal anteriority [intelligible/sensible looks like father/son couple]
GT.linkedContent: khōra is compared to mother & nurse, not part of oppositional couple, 3rd genus, does not belong to “race of women (genos gynaikōn), mother w/out engendering, not an origin, a before signifying no temporal anteriority [intelligible/sensible looks like father/son couple]

GT.content: relation of interval, or the spacing to what is lodged in it to be received
GT.linkedContent: relation of interval, or the spacing to what is lodged in it to be received

R.content: figure of renvoi (remission, sending off, deferral) is like differance, trace, it creates spacing, and brings autoimmune in line with aporia, double bind
R.linkedContent: figure of renvoi (remission, sending off, deferral) is like differance, trace, it creates spacing, and brings autoimmune in line with aporia, double bind

R.content: in The Experience of Freedom, Nancy puts to use Heidegger’s Jemeinigkeit, as singularity of time, each time, as other time, also “ipseity of singularity”; Derrida has concerns this risks saving the “I can” of voluntary-conscious-intentional-deciding-I-myself, while acknowledging that Nancy divides it, ruins it, w/ interval or trace of a spacing [see p. 51]
R.linkedContent: in The Experience of Freedom, Nancy puts to use Heidegger’s Jemeinigkeit, as singularity of time, each time, as other time, also “ipseity of singularity”; Derrida has concerns this risks saving the “I can” of voluntary-conscious-intentional-deciding-I-myself, while acknowledging that Nancy divides it, ruins it, w/ interval or trace of a spacing [see p. 51]

R.content: for Nancy, “freedom is that which spaces and singularizes,” sharing (partage) as spacing
R.linkedContent: for Nancy, “freedom is that which spaces and singularizes,” sharing (partage) as spacing

R.content: khōra or spacing before any reappropriation by a theologico-political history or revelation, even before negative theology (which is fundamentally linked to Christianity)
R.linkedContent: khōra or spacing before any reappropriation by a theologico-political history or revelation, even before negative theology (which is fundamentally linked to Christianity)

R.content: democracy-to-come would be like khōra of political

FL.content: anguishing moment of suspense [who will claim to be just by economizing on anguish?], interval of spacing, in which revolutions take place [cf. GLAS p. 207]
FL.linkedContent: anguishing moment of suspense [who will claim to be just by economizing on anguish?], interval of spacing, in which revolutions take place [cf. GLAS p. 207]

SPOM.content: not only time “out of joint,” but space in time, spacing [re: ontopology, archaism]
SPOM.linkedContent: not only time “out of joint,” but space in time, spacing [re: ontopology, archaism]

SPOM.content: Stirner advocates auto-affection of “I-Me,” where no ghosts can haunt, no spacing, no interstice > thinks this epokhē reduces, exorcises the ghost, Marx thinks it reduces to the ghost
SPOM.linkedContent: Stirner advocates auto-affection of “I-Me,” where no ghosts can haunt, no spacing, no interstice > thinks this epokhē reduces, exorcises the ghost, Marx thinks it reduces to the ghost

SPOM.content: le longtemps, c’est le temps de cette chasse à l’éloignement (hunt for distance, a hunt w/ distance > pray & lure): distance hunt can only hallucinate, desire, defer proximity: lure & prey
SPOM.linkedContent: le longtemps, c’est le temps de cette chasse à l’éloignement (hunt for distance, a hunt w/ distance > pray & lure): distance hunt can only hallucinate, desire, defer proximity: lure & prey

HASD.content: khōra—“third species” > gives place, atemporality itself of spacing
HASD.linkedContent: khōra—“third species” > gives place, atemporality itself of spacing

HASD.content: “spacing of khora introduces a dissociation or a difference in the proper meaning that it renders possible, thereby compelling tropic detours which are no longer rhetorical figures”
HASD.linkedContent: “spacing of khora introduces a dissociation or a difference in the proper meaning that it renders possible, thereby compelling tropic detours which are no longer rhetorical figures”

SEC.content: spacing of mark (possibility of extraction, grafting)—not negative or sublatable
SEC.linkedContent: spacing of mark (possibility of extraction, grafting)—not negative or sublatable

EM.content: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination

EM.content: [here Derrida shows limits of Heidegger’s deconstruction?] prevalence given to phenomenological metaphor (phainesthai, shining, lighting, clearing, Lichtung) opens to space of presence, presence of space, opposition near & far > thought prior to opposition space & time, opening of a spacing which belongs to neither, dislocates while producing presence of the present
EM.linkedContent: [here Derrida shows limits of Heidegger’s deconstruction?] prevalence given to phenomenological metaphor (phainesthai, shining, lighting, clearing, Lichtung) opens to space of presence, presence of space, opposition near & far > thought prior to opposition space & time, opening of a spacing which belongs to neither, dislocates while producing presence of the present

EM.content: in Heidegger’s fourfold: near and far before presence, before opposition of space and time
EM.linkedContent: in Heidegger’s fourfold: near and far before presence, before opposition of space and time

VM.content: deportation from its [logos’] own site toward the Site, toward spatial locality, is the metaphor congenital to philosophical logos > metaphor (before being rhetorical procedure) would be emergence of language itself
VM.linkedContent: deportation from its [logos’] own site toward the Site, toward spatial locality, is the metaphor congenital to philosophical logos > metaphor (before being rhetorical procedure) would be emergence of language itself

VM.content: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space
VM.linkedContent: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space

VM.content: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”
VM.linkedContent: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”

VM.content: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself
VM.linkedContent: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself

VM.content: structure [inside-outside] has no meaning w/out included origin, inscribed eastern horizon which is neither w/in nor w/out space
VM.linkedContent: structure [inside-outside] has no meaning w/out included origin, inscribed eastern horizon which is neither w/in nor w/out space

VM.content: in classical infinitism (Descartes) neutralization of space to liberate positive infinity, body: exteriority, zero point, origin of space, an origin which has no meaning w/out of, origin inseparable from genitivity, from space it engenders/orients, an inscribed origin, written, traced
VM.linkedContent: in classical infinitism (Descartes) neutralization of space to liberate positive infinity, body: exteriority, zero point, origin of space, an origin which has no meaning w/out of, origin inseparable from genitivity, from space it engenders/orients, an inscribed origin, written, traced

VM.content: [by following Levinas closely] isn’t speech by its essence rooted in space?
VM.linkedContent: [by following Levinas closely] isn’t speech by its essence rooted in space?

PP.content: space of writing, space as writing, opens in violent movement of surrogation, difference btween mnēmē and hypomnēsis.
PP.linkedContent: space of writing, space as writing, opens in violent movement of surrogation, difference btween mnēmē and hypomnēsis.

VP.content: temporalization of sense is “spacing,” spacing as openness to outside means no absolute interiority; “space” is in time > the pure exiting of time to the outside of itself
VP.linkedContent: temporalization of sense is “spacing,” spacing as openness to outside means no absolute interiority; “space” is in time > the pure exiting of time to the outside of itself

PAS.content: Blanchot’s figures, room, sea, staircase, etc. are going to be effaced, figures san figure; not places in space, but they have a certain horizontality (thus the attribution of spatial horizon)
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s figures, room, sea, staircase, etc. are going to be effaced, figures san figure; not places in space, but they have a certain horizontality (thus the attribution of spatial horizon)

PAS.content: is Blanchot’s diabolical démarche: 1) a mastery, which presumes to escape its own trap, believes the maze, the labyrinth, the staircase are a space w/ traps 2) or, very spacing of its pas?
PAS.linkedContent: is Blanchot’s diabolical démarche: 1) a mastery, which presumes to escape its own trap, believes the maze, the labyrinth, the staircase are a space w/ traps 2) or, very spacing of its pas?

PAS.content: Blanchot: this laughter ran along border of space, w/out crossing it, seemed to be that space
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: this laughter ran along border of space, w/out crossing it, seemed to be that space

PAS.content: acc. Heidegger, one must not say that the body alone has spatiality, this would be naive opinion (naïve Meinung) where spiritual being is transposed after the fact (nachträglich) into space
PAS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, one must not say that the body alone has spatiality, this would be naive opinion (naïve Meinung) where spiritual being is transposed after the fact (nachträglich) into space

FSW.content: breaching concerns forces & locations, Freud has to reinvent the concept of spacing
FSW.linkedContent: breaching concerns forces & locations, Freud has to reinvent the concept of spacing

FSW.content: Freud invents ω neurones btwn ϕ and Ψ to account for that which understands quality, temporality in spacing, that which perceives the period, the break
FSW.linkedContent: Freud invents ω neurones btwn ϕ and Ψ to account for that which understands quality, temporality in spacing, that which perceives the period, the break

FSW.content: when Freud renounces neurology & anatomical localizations, trace becomes gramme, and region of breaching, a ciphered spacing
FSW.linkedContent: when Freud renounces neurology & anatomical localizations, trace becomes gramme, and region of breaching, a ciphered spacing

FSW.content: agreeing w/ Saussure that signifier/signified two sides of same paper, originary writing must still produce space & materiality of sheet itself
FSW.linkedContent: agreeing w/ Saussure that signifier/signified two sides of same paper, originary writing must still produce space & materiality of sheet itself

FSW.content: fundamental property of writing is spacing: diastem (interval, interruption) & time becoming space, unfolding (not linear time) [see Nancy’s Corpus on diastole]
FSW.linkedContent: fundamental property of writing is spacing: diastem (interval, interruption) & time becoming space, unfolding (not linear time) [see Nancy’s Corpus on diastole]

FSW.content: pure words and pure things: “theoretical fictions”; words can be treated as things because of spacing, materiality of mark
FSW.linkedContent: pure words and pure things: “theoretical fictions”; words can be treated as things because of spacing, materiality of mark

FSW.content: most interesting analogy of Mystic Pad is time, a discontinuous time, time as spacing, withdrawal of perception, periodic non-excitability > interruption/restoration of contact
FSW.linkedContent: most interesting analogy of Mystic Pad is time, a discontinuous time, time as spacing, withdrawal of perception, periodic non-excitability > interruption/restoration of contact

FSW.content: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility
FSW.linkedContent: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility

T.content: like w/ Mystic Pad, question of writing machine should upset (devrait fair basculer) space of proper body dans l’entraînement sans limite des machines de machines et donc de machines à main coupée
T.linkedContent: like w/ Mystic Pad, question of writing machine should upset (devrait fair basculer) space of proper body dans l’entraînement sans limite des machines de machines et donc de machines à main coupée

PPHS.content: Hegel against Leibniz, mathematics, Pythagoras, all perversions of philosophical model, must “pass through” spacing, exteriority & death (see “Preface” of Pheno…) [not remain]
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel against Leibniz, mathematics, Pythagoras, all perversions of philosophical model, must “pass through” spacing, exteriority & death (see “Preface” of Pheno…) [not remain]

SH.content: poet is provoked, constituted, by the hour, its caesuras > poetic rhythm or spacing at heart of origin of meaning, meaning of language
SH.linkedContent: poet is provoked, constituted, by the hour, its caesuras > poetic rhythm or spacing at heart of origin of meaning, meaning of language

FWT.content: no “free subject,” but certain space of freedom opened by event, spacing liberated, dis-engaged, before & for the pledge (le gage); “with the determinism you spoke of”—no future
FWT.linkedContent: no “free subject,” but certain space of freedom opened by event, spacing liberated, dis-engaged, before & for the pledge (le gage); “with the determinism you spoke of”—no future

DS.content: what ruins the “pious capital letter,” the aplomb of the heading: the blanks, ordered return of white spaces, measure & order of dissemination, law of spacing, rhythmos, invisible fleuron
DS.linkedContent: what ruins the “pious capital letter,” the aplomb of the heading: the blanks, ordered return of white spaces, measure & order of dissemination, law of spacing, rhythmos, invisible fleuron

DS.content: space of writing: “event” in which nothing happens—hymen, crime, suicide, spasm (laughter/pleasure): everything describes structure of text & effectuates its possibility > a lustre which is nothing beyond its own fragmented light
DS.linkedContent: space of writing: “event” in which nothing happens—hymen, crime, suicide, spasm (laughter/pleasure): everything describes structure of text & effectuates its possibility > a lustre which is nothing beyond its own fragmented light

DS.content: “btwn” re-marks its semantic void, becomes quasi-categorem, marks opening btwn syntax/semantics > its meaning: possibility of syntax, spacing [Spinoza, “btwns” in Hebrew]
DS.linkedContent: “btwn” re-marks its semantic void, becomes quasi-categorem, marks opening btwn syntax/semantics > its meaning: possibility of syntax, spacing [Spinoza, “btwns” in Hebrew]

DS.content: inserting spacing into interiority does not allow inside to identify w/ itself, close upon itself
DS.linkedContent: inserting spacing into interiority does not allow inside to identify w/ itself, close upon itself

DS.content: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play

DS.content: [re: Mallarmé] to write the word insertion (to place w/in, to graft) is to quote the practice of spacing (same goes for writing antre ouvert)
DS.linkedContent: [re: Mallarmé] to write the word insertion (to place w/in, to graft) is to quote the practice of spacing (same goes for writing antre ouvert)

DS.content: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture
DS.linkedContent: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture

DS.content: “fiction,” “hymen,” “spacious” are caught in, while disrupting, ontological machine

each “full” white thing in Mallarmé (snow, swan, paper, virginity) is trope of “empty” white space, constellation of “blanks,” there everywhere, reproduced in spacings > la disséminaton des blancs (nous ne dirons pas de la blancheur)
DS.linkedContent: each “full” white thing in Mallarmé (snow, swan, paper, virginity) is trope of “empty” white space, constellation of “blanks,” there everywhere, reproduced in spacings > la disséminaton des blancs (nous ne dirons pas de la blancheur)

DS.content: le pli (se) plie: son sens s’espace d’une double marque, au creux de laquelle un blanc se plie
DS.linkedContent: le pli (se) plie: son sens s’espace d’une double marque, au creux de laquelle un blanc se plie

POS.content: spacing as not only the space, but an operation, production, genetic (generative): spacing ensures no overlap of any two concepts, no privileging of a concept
POS.linkedContent: spacing as not only the space, but an operation, production, genetic (generative): spacing ensures no overlap of any two concepts, no privileging of a concept

POS.content: spacing indicates an irreducible alterity, is indissociable from concept alterity
POS.linkedContent: spacing indicates an irreducible alterity, is indissociable from concept alterity

POS.content: spacing operates in all fields but could never account for each particular difference [compare to Foucault]
POS.linkedContent: spacing operates in all fields but could never account for each particular difference [compare to Foucault]

POS.content: Derrida does not apply spacing to negate that which is ‘present,’ this would remain logic of Hegelian Aufhebung, Derrida’s nonpresence not found in opposition presence/absence
POS.linkedContent: Derrida does not apply spacing to negate that which is ‘present,’ this would remain logic of Hegelian Aufhebung, Derrida’s nonpresence not found in opposition presence/absence

OS.content: space becomes concrete by retaining/restoring negative w/in itself, by negating itself
OS.linkedContent: space becomes concrete by retaining/restoring negative w/in itself, by negating itself

OS.content: 1st negative determination of space is the POINT (the place that does not take place), it then negates itself in relation the LINE > als sich aufhebend, point is the line, the Being-spatial of point > then comes the PLANE (surface) > each next stage only made of the negated prior stage, i.e. line made of negated points
OS.linkedContent: 1st negative determination of space is the POINT (the place that does not take place), it then negates itself in relation the LINE > als sich aufhebend, point is the line, the Being-spatial of point > then comes the PLANE (surface) > each next stage only made of the negated prior stage, i.e. line made of negated points

OS.content: “always too late to ask the question of time” re: spatialization
OS.linkedContent: “always too late to ask the question of time” re: spatialization

OS.content: point & time thought in circularity together (Aufhebung, speculative negativity, only possible by means of infinite correlation or reflection) > time is spacing, space is time > thus for Aristotle, stigmē, punctuality, determines nowness (nun, jetzt)
OS.linkedContent: point & time thought in circularity together (Aufhebung, speculative negativity, only possible by means of infinite correlation or reflection) > time is spacing, space is time > thus for Aristotle, stigmē, punctuality, determines nowness (nun, jetzt)

O.content: in thus remaining [outside of oppositions, i.e. sensible/intelligible], does a preface exist? son espacement (préface à une relecture) s’écarte au lieu de la khōra > remarkable limen of the text: what can be read of dissemination > limen: mark, march, margin, mise en marche: citation
O.linkedContent: in thus remaining [outside of oppositions, i.e. sensible/intelligible], does a preface exist? son espacement (préface à une relecture) s’écarte au lieu de la khōra > remarkable limen of the text: what can be read of dissemination > limen: mark, march, margin, mise en marche: citation

Gi.content: the spatial, spacing dispersion, origin of spacing first manifested in language > language determined by spatial meanings (Raumbedeutungen) [via Heidegger]
Gi.linkedContent: the spatial, spacing dispersion, origin of spacing first manifested in language > language determined by spatial meanings (Raumbedeutungen) [via Heidegger]

DST.content: in the beginning was rhythm, said von Bülow, no simple beginning; Lacoue-Labarthe: “différence-à-soi répétée du Même” > no rhythm w/out repetition, spacing, caesura
DST.linkedContent: in the beginning was rhythm, said von Bülow, no simple beginning; Lacoue-Labarthe: “différence-à-soi répétée du Même” > no rhythm w/out repetition, spacing, caesura

DST.content: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)
DST.linkedContent: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)

AFR.content: the frivolous: (time of a) difference (of degree), spacing which ontology isn’t capable of, con-, de-struction are breached, line of disintegration (not straight/continuous/regular); philosophy deviates from itself, strikes itself w/ blows from outside > deconstruction is possible
AFR.linkedContent: the frivolous: (time of a) difference (of degree), spacing which ontology isn’t capable of, con-, de-struction are breached, line of disintegration (not straight/continuous/regular); philosophy deviates from itself, strikes itself w/ blows from outside > deconstruction is possible

D.content: whiteness of virgin paper, blankness of transparent column, air > more than neutrality of some medium, uncovers space of play, play of space
D.linkedContent: whiteness of virgin paper, blankness of transparent column, air > more than neutrality of some medium, uncovers space of play, play of space

TN.content: the move from body extension to extension of psyche/thinking is incommensurable > a place (lieu) neither of objective space nor extension: place (lieu) as spacing before space
TN.linkedContent: the move from body extension to extension of psyche/thinking is incommensurable > a place (lieu) neither of objective space nor extension: place (lieu) as spacing before space

TN.content: Nancy: “the incommensurable extension of thinking is the opening of the mouth” > mouth as union of soul/body; Nancy accords decisive authority to “quasi” in Descartes’ “quasi permixtio”
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: “the incommensurable extension of thinking is the opening of the mouth” > mouth as union of soul/body; Nancy accords decisive authority to “quasi” in Descartes’ “quasi permixtio”

TN.content: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung

TN.content: spasm & distension: passage that confirms gap btwn extension and spacing
TN.linkedContent: spasm & distension: passage that confirms gap btwn extension and spacing

TN.content: for Freud, the spatiality of space, exteriority, is a projection of an internal, psychical extension
TN.linkedContent: for Freud, the spatiality of space, exteriority, is a projection of an internal, psychical extension

TN.content: phenomenology finds greatest resistance where extension, place, localization are at issue > nous abordons ainsi une zone de spatialité, extension of the psyche
TN.linkedContent: phenomenology finds greatest resistance where extension, place, localization are at issue > nous abordons ainsi une zone de spatialité, extension of the psyche

TN.content: for Husserl, duplicity of sensible impression/apprehension occurs via a certain necessary exteriority, an outside as “real quality of a thing” (it partakes even in illusions)
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, duplicity of sensible impression/apprehension occurs via a certain necessary exteriority, an outside as “real quality of a thing” (it partakes even in illusions)

TN.content: if foreign outside, space of material thing, slips btwn touching/touched, i.e. the heterogeneity of spacing > won’t a hand touching itself experience this detour?
TN.linkedContent: if foreign outside, space of material thing, slips btwn touching/touched, i.e. the heterogeneity of spacing > won’t a hand touching itself experience this detour?

TN.content: intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)
TN.linkedContent: intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)

TN.content: Nancy, partage—parting, sharing, spacing, syncope, irreducible partition, gives “it” a chance menacée, heartbeat’s the other’s beat (le même battement—de l’autre, du coeur de l’autre)
TN.linkedContent: Nancy, partage—parting, sharing, spacing, syncope, irreducible partition, gives “it” a chance menacée, heartbeat’s the other’s beat (le même battement—de l’autre, du coeur de l’autre)

TN.content: irreducible spacing: first word of any deconstruction

touching w/out touching, touching in passing the touchable > “time to space itself,” “espace du passage qui fait donc partage” [spacing-time], the time needed for touching [co-existence as w/, as other]
TN.linkedContent: touching w/out touching, touching in passing the touchable > “time to space itself,” “espace du passage qui fait donc partage” [spacing-time], the time needed for touching [co-existence as w/, as other]

TN.content: irreducible spacing: hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact
TN.linkedContent: irreducible spacing: hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact

TN.content: “cet espacement fait l’épreuve du non-contact comme la condition ou l’expérience même du contact, l’expérience même du même à jamais ouverte (forever open)—et par l’autre espacée” [hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact]
TN.linkedContent: “cet espacement fait l’épreuve du non-contact comme la condition ou l’expérience même du contact, l’expérience même du même à jamais ouverte (forever open)—et par l’autre espacée” [hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact]

TN.content: singularity takes place and takes place of (a lieu et tient lieu), inscribing technical prosthetics onto singularity of event itself, because of this spacing: takes place, l’événement d’une venue
TN.linkedContent: singularity takes place and takes place of (a lieu et tient lieu), inscribing technical prosthetics onto singularity of event itself, because of this spacing: takes place, l’événement d’une venue

TN.content: differance btwn 2 surfaces: condition of contact & originarily spaced opening that calls for technical prosthetics (makes it possible w/out delay)
TN.linkedContent: differance btwn 2 surfaces: condition of contact & originarily spaced opening that calls for technical prosthetics (makes it possible w/out delay)

EU.content: relation of linguistic subjugation [forced to share language] to the clearing/controlling of borders, roads, routes, regions, territories [see p. 8 method (odos)] > power of spacing, body of writing, to clear a path (language here is neither secondary nor primary)
EU.linkedContent: relation of linguistic subjugation [forced to share language] to the clearing/controlling of borders, roads, routes, regions, territories [see p. 8 method (odos)] > power of spacing, body of writing, to clear a path (language here is neither secondary nor primary)
